result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley A Byrd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley A Byrd in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Joe Domask, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $75.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAR

Court orders defendant to report to the Milwaukee County Jail by 5:00 pm on 09-21-2022 to be booked and released. Failure to report will result in the issuance of a bench warrant. 
The Court ordered No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bradley A Byrd in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.
Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 10.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/19/22 @ 2:30p
